text: Psalm 64
A Plea for Divine Retribution
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 64 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting.
Preserve my life from \add the\add* fear of \add the\add* enemy.
Hide me from \add the\add* secret plots\f + \fr 64:2 \ft Hebrew “plot” \f* of evildoers,
from \add the\add* unrest of \add those who\add* do iniquity,
who sharpen their tongue like a sword.
They bend \add their bow to shoot\add* their arrows—bitter words,
to shoot from\f + \fr 64:4 \ft Hebrew “in” \f* their\f + \fr 64:4 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* hiding places \add at the\add* blameless.
Suddenly they shoot \add at\add* him and do not fear.
They encourage themselves \add in the\add* evil matter.
They talk of secretly laying snares.
They say, “Who will see them?”
⸤They carefully plot⸥\f + \fr 64:6 \ft Literally “They search out” \f* injustices \add saying\add*,
“We have perfected ⸤the perfect plot⸥!”\f + \fr 64:6 \ft Literally “a plotted plot” \f*
Both \add the\add* ⸤inner thought⸥\f + \fr 64:6 \ft Literally “inward part” \f* and heart of \add a\add* man \add are\add* deep.
But God will shoot them;
with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.
\f + \fr 64:8 \ft The Hebrew of this verse is very difficult \f* And they \add who\add* would cause him\f + \fr 64:8 \ft That is, the psalmist \f* to stumble,
their \add own\add* tongue \add will be\add* against them.
All who gaze on them will shake.\f + \fr 64:8 \ft Perhaps a shaking of the head; a similar Hebrew form could be translated “will flee” \f*
And then\f + \fr 64:9 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* all men\f + \fr 64:9 \ft Hebrew “man” \f* will fear,
and will declare the working of God,
and will understand his doing.
\add The\add* righteous will rejoice in Yahweh and take refuge in him,
and all \add the\add* upright in heart will boast.
